issue.title: Don't auto-rotate doors when not hovered over a (vertical) wall segment

content.raw:
What seems to be happening is that when the door hovers a wall, it gets the wall's orientation, but whenever it's not over a wall, it is horizontal. So when you hover one of your vertical walls, the door gets vertical, but the moment you hover empty space, the door goes back to horizontal, making it feel like it snapped to the perpendicular.

I [turned off](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/64494b1e1ec07957ad35eafa28a6ccbe52f36ff8) the part that resets the door when it leaves the wall. So basically, whenever you hover a wall and then hover away from it, you keep the wall's orientation - in your case, the door doesn't auto-rotate back to horizontal. Does this make sense? Would this be enough?

issue.title: Don't auto-rotate doors when not hovered over a (vertical) wall segment

content.raw:
I just found issue #1423, basically, we can edit a feature's position from the inspector and this might take it away from the wall.

If we go with the idea above, which is that a feature should always belong to a wall, perhaps we shouldn't allow the user to edit the feature's global position... An idea would be to remove xy position from the inspector and have something like `Distance from wall's start point` instead.
